item.title: farzam add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: farzam add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: farzam add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: farzam add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: farzam add a quote by Sigmund Freud
item.description: "We are never so defenseless against suffering as when we love." -- Sigmund Freud

item.title: farzam add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: farzam add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "You don't write because you want to say something, you write because you have something to say." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: farzam add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I like people and I like them to like me, but I wear my heart where God put it, on the inside. " -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: farzam add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does. It is up to you to give [life] a meaning." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: farzam add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "I am alone in the midst of these happy, reasonable voices. All these creatures spend their time explaining, realizing happily that they agree with each other. In Heaven's name, why is it so important to think the same things all together. " -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: farzam add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "But when the strong were too weak to hurt the weak, the weak had to be strong enough to leave." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: farzam add a quote by Sigmund Freud
item.description: "Religious doctrines â€¦ are all illusions, they do not admit of proof, and no one can be compelled to consider them as true or to believe in them." -- Sigmund Freud

item.title: farzam add a quote by Charlie Kaufman
item.description: "There are too many ideas and things and people. Too many directions to go. I was starting to believe the reason it matters to care passionately about something, is that it whittles the world down to a more manageable size." -- Charlie Kaufman

item.title: farzam add a quote by Charlie Kaufman
item.description: "And the truth is I feel so angry, and the truth is I feel so fucking sad, and the truth is I've felt so fucking hurt for so fucking long and for just as long I've been pretending I'm OK, just to get along, just for, I don't know why, maybe because no one wants to hear about my misery, because they have their own. Well, fuck everybody. Amen." -- Charlie Kaufman
